intro: Neoacanthophora scandens, commonly known as the climbing acanthophora, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its slender, twining stems that climb by means of tendrils. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
